question.text:
A few statements are made about the characteristics of prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells.
Mark the correct statement.

options.text: All prokaryotes lack nuclear envelope but nuclear envelope is present in mitochondria of eukaryotes.
All eukaryotes have a cell wall surrounding the cell membrane but cell wall is absent in mycoplasma.
All eukaryotic cells are identical but all prokaryotic cells are not identical.
Most of the eukaryotic chromosomes are associated with histone protein but the genome of chloroplast lack histones.

solution.text: Histones are highly alkaline proteins found in nuclei of eukaryotic cell that helps in packing of DNA into structural units called nucleosomes present in only eukaryotic chromosomes, Chloroplasts are like tiny green factories within plant cells, which help in converting energy from sunlight into sugars, and they have many similarities to mitochondria (both chloroplast and mitochondria lack histone protein in their genome).
